0.text:
At TestTube Daily we try to bring you the
most compelling stories, but there are always

4.text:
a few that don’t make the cut. So here’s
a weekly round up of our favorites that you

9.text:
might’ve missed.
Japan’s population has fallen to a 15 year

15.text:
low  Those over 65 now outnumber those under
14 at two to one.

20.text:
By 2060, the population is forecasted to drop
by over 40 million. The drop has been blamed

27.text:
on low birth rates and longer life expectancy.
The Justice Department and the FBI have admitted

35.text:
that for decades, their forensic units gave
flawed testimony in nearly all hair-matching

40.text:
cases, leading to at least 32 death sentences.
In 95% of reviewed cases, forensics misrepresented

48.text:
results to favor prosecutors.   
Around the world, marijuana enthusiasts took

55.text:
part in 4/20; an unofficial holiday celebrating
the popular drug.

59.text:
In the United States, marijuana is the most
commonly used illicit substance. Nearly half

64.text:
of Americans have admitted to trying it.
A 93-year old former SS guard at the Auschwitz

71.text:
death camp is put on trial. He is charged
with the deaths of 300,000 Hungarian Jews.

77.text:
If found guilty, he could be sentenced for
up to 15 years.

83.text:
US Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell
introduced a bill to extend the Patriot Act

88.text:
until December 2020.
Without the extension, the Patriot Act’s

93.text:
authorization of roving NSA surveillance is
set to expire in June 2015.

100.text:
Are there any other stories we missed? Let
us know in the comments. And as always, don’t
